page.title: 09BERWICK CHURCH EXTERIOR
page.content: EXTERIOR OF CHURCH. On South side there is a scratch clock like a sundial.Flat roof gives church an unusual appearance but two small towers added in 1855.Called the Pepperpots.One tower holds a small bell.Footscrapers at each side of door.No burials for 100 yrs as graveyard was full.Very old gravestones removed because dangerous.Garden of Remembrance now used for burial of ashes- names of people buried there in large book inside church.Inscribed on pillars of gates is name of William Temple-Mayor of Berwick in 1753 when Town Hall was built.The famous Archbishop of Canterbury was his great great grandson.Many trees in churchyard including yew,ash and sycamore.
